Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coconut drink
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0dNDP_xhB6uM0Ab49Z2aFw.text: Great meal! Great vibe! Great service. Top to bottom a fantastic experience. Hostesses were helpful as they tried to help us find just the right table to celebrate my sons 30th bday! Our server Corbin was incredibly knowledgeable friendly and attentive from beginning to end (even while they were slammed!) David,  the owner came to the table not just to say hi and move on but really chat to get a sense of how he could make this a special night for all of us... 5 stars all the way!

HvJTC2bek1iXCDbQZARuGQ.text: Lights Out Fabulous Food! Cauliflower, Brussel Sprouts were outstanding. Eggplant Meatballs were excellent. Roasted bone marrow was one of the best apps ever and the lamb ragout was phenomenal. Great service and great value. More curious Yelp Hit Squad 1-Star reviews Yalda K. Boston MA: "I thought this could finally be a Phoenix brunch place that could compare with my experiences in bigger cities." Oh how droll of us bottom feeders out west. "No artisan (decent) coffee in this place." YGBSM? Bill D. Phoenix AZ: A ten paragraph neurotic novel on how he didn't like his experience. Bill...your Man-card please. To these Yelp Assassins: youtube.com/watch?v=pDlR... Great restaurant making delicious food.

j31PupWfWxC-_9B8BLGmhA.text: Wonderful brunch with giant portion sizes! Great ambience and service. The prices are reasonable so we can definitely make this a usual brunch spot. Good place to take guests from out of town, especially when the weather is nice out! Will be back to try their dinner menu.

q2aNYZaIt9p2OeeHb6cr6g.text: I ordered the crispy falafel dish from the "light" section. The falafel patty was a little bland and dry for my taste, but the lime pickle sauce made up for it. The fresh ingredients taste like it's picked from the backyard garden. The price for the quality was reasonable; I'll def go again for Sunday brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

agraiTZeF1PaL6KhfRpQRA.text: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly  The Good... The flavor of my pasta dish was great. $19 for linguini the size of my fist is questionable but it was good The Bad... The drinks. Our table ordered a beer, two Spanish G&T's and a glass of rose.  My rose showed up after my food, the G&T's had zero alcohol in them and then to insult to injury the server gave us a 5% discount due to the lateness of the drinks coming but I would have gladly given it back just for some gin in those drinks The Ugly... We sat out on the back patio and honestly I should have said no from the beginning and to sit us inside. Not sure but I just got a weird vibe when we walked out and my instincts were right on.  Service was atrocious and we have had this particular server multiple times.  We were sitting there for 10 minutes before we got water, the server 5 min later but only after we walked up front and asked if we had one.  He half apologized but his overall demeanor was very casual and while he seemed slammed, he seemed mostly uninterested and just overall indifferent.   It wasn't just him though, NO ONE was happy, everyone seemed like they couldn't wait for the place to close.    They need a manager there that keeps things inline, helps servers when they need it, and just overall care about their customers.  The manager on duty (not sure if it was really her) last night needed to quit chatting with her friends at work and manage that restaurant better.    We've given this place four tries now and won't be back.  Lunch service is better but the nighttime shift needs improvement before we would come back.  Honestly it was sad, we've had this particular server multiple times and last night was the worse.   Owners of Ocotillo... train your staff and stay on top of training.  Explain that there are some that saw a movie or a play and likes to eat at 8:30 and while we all know people would like to go home or go out with your friends this is a place of business to SERVE people.

BrA5TM_peDefFHrinDqoFQ.text: I ended coming here with a friend after we were told the Henry had an hour wait. Arrived and were seated at the bar immediately! The inside of Ocotillo is very cool- industrial glam with a mix of farmhouse (???) I would say. The food was good, I got the chimichanga and I would have asked for the sauce on the side if I'd known it would be smothered in it (the sauce was good, there was just too much). The tortilla was also very heavy/greasy from being fried, and I ended up only eating half. My friend got the ahi tuna bowl and she said it was good! It looked really pretty and fresh. The service was great and quick. I probably wouldn't come again though, the brunch menu is pretty limited. But I have heard the lunch is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vZRcZ2ScbTtLgkiSo1_3eg.text: I absolutely love this spot. Been here 5+ times and can't wait to see what they've added to the menu.  I've been to Ocotillo for lunch, dinner, and happy hour, and none of my visits were ever disappointing. My most recent visit was for lunch, and I ordered the cauliflower as a starter and the salmon sandwich as my entree, and my guest got the philly cheesesteak and butternut squash soup. (It was her first time there and she absolutely gushed about the soup and was so excited to finish the rest of it at dinnertime!)  The drinks are always tasty, and they tend to have decent happy hour prices.   As some have said, parking isn't necessarily the easiest, but they do have their own lot and street parking as well. That being said, when in this area of Phoenix I usually assume parking will be a pain and it's definitely still easier here than most spots.  The outdoor patio (and bar) are great to sit in, specifically during the perfect weather months here in AZ.   Overall I think their prices are extremely fair given the quality of the food as well as the service you receive. Not to mention the ambience!

jX8gNfhdPJJV18p0CikXbg.text: My coffee was luke warm at best and my lunch was very mediocre for the price. Probably the worst part was the outdoor seating. We were unfortunate enough to sit directly in line with the men's bathroom. Every time the door opened we were privy to men standing at the urinals. It was hard to have much of an appetite. Either don't use this table or put a barrier at the opening.

HkBRqzdhdq-52s7o_ZyaZQ.text: One word. Disappointed. I pass this place all the time so I decided to go for my first time today for my Birthday lunch.The place is cool but the food is meh. We ordered different things and they were meh so we agreed on 3 stars. To make matters worse my friend and I feel sick (if you know what I mean) So our rating went down to 2 Stars. I think I will skip this place for food and IF.... IF I go again I will just try the coffee bar or the bar.

OlLRoXP4Q8DjmMqAXJGpww.text: I originally really enjoyed the idea of this place because the food was different and good (while a bit too pricey).  Because of the nice outdoor area, you would think it wasn't as pricey or that they would welcome after work people at the picnic tables after work.  I went with a large group after work.  Unfortunately, there isn't any type of reasonably priced appetizers or happy hour.  I spent a ridiculous amount of money and unfortunately others were soured on it.  Go for real dinner but NOT for any type of after work or happy hour.  It is a bit pricier than it probably needs to be as well.

hoeUH5lC3zj7o6KsWHpnkQ.text: Not sure what happened this visit. Been here twice before and usually sit at the bar.  I'm not sure what they were trying to accomplish but there was not enough server presence on the floor. We came right around 1015a. It seemed as if our server had way too many tables spread out. They were out of multiple dishes and drinks that I was trying to order. Which is fine. Just adjust the menu or just do a better job ordering. It slows the server down to go back and forth and puts the guest in an awkward situation to have to order on the spot. Food was decent as it has been before. Tried to modify the burrito but was told they were premade. Huh? At a place that has an increased check average and a large kitchen making items from scratch what's the benefit to precooking eggs and rolling them in a burrito. We eat out often with our two year old and we play the get in and get out game.  We order a bunch of food and our drinks fast so in return get us our check and bus our table. We literally had to get up, go to the host stand and ask for our bill so we could scram.   Dial in uniforms. Dirty, sloppy appearances is a tragedy. Stained wrinkled shirts and hair everywhere on support staff is off putting.  Oh just to hook you up with my last bit of annoying advice...the pictures in the main dining room look great but are hung crooked. So a three piece ensemble looks bad not lined up.

DNKmSCZ4J9M08vZn6K6MfA.text: Never again will I visit this place...2.5 hours to receive our food.  Our waiter needs to find a new profession.  Maybe something a bit slower in pace for the confused Gent.  How about something in Government?

8Mljk6-sb5KvI-ejV5L_BA.text: I watched this place slowly come to life through its construction to opening.   Never a bad meal.  We moved to Washington State, but still stop in to see GM David Johnson when in town.  Hadn't seen my brother in a couple of years and he was in town for work.  We met at Ocotillo for dinner.  Great food again. My brother remarked multiple times about the thought that went into the design of the place.  I was bummed that drink "Number Four" had been rotated off of the menu, but there was still the usual great list to choose from.  Another wonderful night at Ocotillo.

Pi3F--l57ijp4ZoWCiOVRQ.text: Went here for brunch on a super busy Sunday so we ended up sitting at the outdoor bar and absolutely loved our experience. Our food was some of the best brunch food we've had in Phoenix for quite some time and the menu was fairly large! The actual space was beautiful, hip, and so much bigger than expected. Our bartender/server was AWESOME, despite how slammed she was. Great spot for a large group brunch but I can't wait to come back for dinner!

UamjQoTYW6Jt5JgCP7WE9A.text: Tried this newer restaurant this week for happy hour with my friend.  The HH menu was great but more importantly, the food was AWESOME!!  Ordered the meatballs and the sweet potatoes with fennel.  The flavors and sauces were great.  I would love to see what dinner brings!  Highly recommend.

v0yPcMou3hOdQfuPvRfddA.text: AMAZING! Visited for the first time a few days ago with a friend and the setting was very cool, modern and hip. Very busy and loud but I think that adds to the ambience. Everything we ordered was DELICIOUS! started with the meatball appetizer had the pasta with the pork ragu and finished with the chamomile panna cotta and I can't wait to go back to get it all again!!! Can't wait to go back when he weather isn't so hot because they have a really great outdoor area! The service was so-so but it won't stop me from coming back and giving it another try!

9I8kmEuqB_L6cky6UM8G0w.text: This place is great! Love the food. The atmosphere is awesome.  The hostess, Celeste, was super friendly and conversational. Our server was amazing.  I'm telling all of my friends to come here

rYLoFqkbSmSrEvZS5ITaxA.text: Great venue, and great coffee shop. But the main restaurant? I used to feel so/so about the service, until I came for Happy Hour with work colleagues and got Bryce as our server. He was fantastic! Incredibly fun, friendly, and well-informed on the drinks. I ended up with some great cocktails and wine, including The Last One- really hit the spot. Thanks, Bryce and Ocotillo Cafe for an awesome experience!

5TAhdObcvdITADLUEujpMA.text: I've been to Ocotillo twice. The first time was an okay experience. The service was lacking, but the food was great - definitely worth a second chance. On my second trip to Ocotillo a few months later, I came in with high hopes. We were promptly seated for brunch, but it took almost 10 minutes to get menus or place a drink order. The restaurant was busy, but in no way full. When our server did come, she seemed very put-out and was extremely rude to us. So rude, in fact, that we left the restaurant. I don't think I've ever left a restaurant after placing an order. The manager quickly apologized, but we will not be going back.

whnGLPX3QlzJ8e7ARtKbQA.text: Went twice in one day, who does that?  A friend was in town with some guests and we needed a lunch place. The hotel concierge at the Hilton near by suggested Ocotillo.  I thought I had been here before cause we try everything new that we can in Phoenix but I was getting it confused with another place in Central Phoenix that is very good.  Anyway, after entering the restaurant and realizing it was not the place I had been to before I was intrigued, delighted, and curious.  The space itself is amazing!  We did not have any problems with the service at lunch or dinner.  So for lunch we had the beet and riccotta salad, chicken meatballs, and the pork sandwich.  Every bite including the french fries was incredible!  Sharing was really fun and satisfying cause it was hard to choose, almost every menu options sounded fabulous, our server even said she is picky eater and liked everything on the menu.  So why did we have to come back that evening you ask?  Why not!  We were still in the area and hungry again and there were so many things we wanted to try but couldn't at lunch, besides my friend would not be able to eat here again in probably a very long time.  My daughter can eat chocolate for days so she was delighted to have the chocolate raspberry parfait for lunch and the chocolate pie for dinner with some fried and meatballs for a bit of nutrition!  Great addition to Phoenix area dining.  We will definitely be back but probably just once in a day, not being independently wealthy or anything close to that!

35wwveHQ6gf99UsAwwsPog.text: Had lunch here with my husband. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was fun. We ate outside on the patio on a chilly day. The staff was very accommodating with the heaters. I had the smoked brisket chili and was very impressed...it was served in ceramic/clay type pot and definitely held its temperature! My husband ordered the mole chicken salad and loved it! We saw a few tables order the roasted cauliflower...that will be a must the next time we stop in!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Smoked brisket chili, mole chicken salad and coffee! Delicious x3!

SYkHfekG2PKbn4vAE1sPhA.text: I went with a group of four people and three of us had never been before so we were all looking forward to it.  Its a very cool space and a great atmosphere but a little loud for trying to have conversation.    All of us enjoyed our food but my pasta dish was a little spicy for my liking.  I saw it had chili flakes in it but I didn't think to ask how spicy it was so that was my own fault.  I still ate it and enjoyed, just burned my mouth.  We ordered a single desert to share (watching our figures) and the person brought it to us brought out the wrong desert.  We asked him if it was the desert we ordered and he said yes.  When our waiter came back we asked him and he said, no you got something else.  He offered to take it off the bill for us and that was very nice of him.    Overall a pleasant experience and we all agreed we would go back again.  Its more of a place to go for the experience than the food I would say though.

qaIUps9oXUIqYnSg9J6U-A.text: Had such a good time at this spot. This is my second time coming here. HUGE, open patio, two outdoor bars, a large indoor horseshoe bar. This place is set up! Great beer selection. I had the crispy chicken sandwich the first time and am currently eating the roasted cauliflower. Both to die for. Eat here soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy chicken sandwich. Can&#39;t wait!!!

RVFK64YNOYC7pygk9FfkSg.text: My favorite new restaurant downtown Phoenix. From the amazing food, craft brew, outdoor lounges & the coffee bar, it's a great hang out. The cauliflower appetizer in spicy pesto sauce & the shaved Brussels sprouts kale salad was enough to convince us to order more. Give this place a try & thank me later

U6rnoRQk5EEvu9fg-g3_OA.text: Went with a large group and got mixed reviews. Half of the people did not like their food, a quarter really liked it, the rest stated that it was OK but would not come back. I ordered the roasted fish. It was ok, have had better at this price. Staff was very attentive and service was great. Too bad the food was not great.

eeCEwLzN_hhMKa4JIz9XRw.text: Stopped by last night for dinner this was my first time. The waiter, Eli was so helpful. He knew it was our first time and took such care in his service to us we will definitely be returning. He recommended the Lumache pasta, two thumbs up! Also had cherry tart for desert, the flavors in my mouth were amazing.  I can't wait to return.  The atmosphere was so beautiful. I'll definitely be having my birthday dinner here!

2K0UBdH7H8dUT71UO7WZmg.text: Had a fantastic time celebrating my birthday here.  The staff was absolutely fabulous- super attentive and nice! Seriously I didn't come into contact with anyone who was less than stellar.  Will need to come back to try more food options as I mainly remember the drinks.  The gin and tonic was perfect!! Thanks for making a special day even more special!

62jmcvfSdk3TbmdPC9il2w.text: Today I learned what polenta is. I also learned that it's delicious! Or at least the way it was prepared. Rich and dare I say decadent. The atmosphere, music, and bathroom all tie together perfectly too. There's even a restaurant cat that meanders through the patio. If you approach slowly, he might let you pet him for 3 seconds before scampering off.   I'm not too crazy about the menu layout - a bit confusing. But that could just be me.

PBeDBX8f6ctz1gbe7jTwrQ.text: Rehearsal dinner for 22!   What a wonderful evening it was. The space was lovely and very much magical, the service attentive and the food fantastic.  A wonderful launching point for a great wedding weekend. Thank You!

TNJVak_18n0cfzoGLW8GYw.text: Great decor. Everybody enjoyed themselves.    I ordered chicken wings. They were way too spicy, I couldn't eat them. I wouldn't recommend them.  Best part of the service was, eelll, our server had great hair.

onp-mO_jhAI8MgHb4WnDiA.text: Tonight was probably our 5th or 6th time at Ocotillo.  The first time, maybe 3 years ago, it was awesome.  However, the last two times have been major disappointments.  Tonight was the worst. We called ahead and they said they were busy, but they could get us on the patio.  We arrived at 6:10 pm for our 6:15 reservation. The hostess said we would have to sit in the beer garden, which we thought would be the large area where there is plenty of activity.  However, it turned out we had to sit in the lonely 2 long table area under the tarp.  There was no one else seated there.  We were told they would get our table ready.  It took at least 15 minutes for someone to finally place 4 empty glasses and 4 napkin set ups on the completely empty table.  Once seated we sat for another 15 minutes, at least, until we finally called a hostess over to get our server.  Our server, Brenden, was extremely friendly and sweet.  When he came we were pretty much ready to order, luckily, as we were already over a half hour into the evening.  Our food was good and the time for it to be served was reasonable.  Had we been seated within 5-10 minutes of our arrival (since they knew we were coming) and had the server arrived at our table in 5 or so minutes after our seating, the rest of the evening would have been quite pleasant.   We are not demanding patrons and are typically quite patient, but the frustration started at the hostess table.  There were at least 3 hostesses standing at the hostess pedestal.  The owner was sitting idly across from them.  There were plenty of people there to get the basics set up for our table.  This has happened to us numerous times at Ocotillo...confusion over reservations we made in advance.  We've made reservations by calling as well as by Open Table.  There has never been a time that we walked in and our table was ready and the hostess did not seem puzzled as to why we were even there!!  This would be understandable if they were newly opened, which by the way, happened on our first visit there.  The owner seems to be oblivious to the floundering at the front door!!   We always WANT to like this place and want to have a nice visit.  However, there has never been a time that things ran smoothly to be seated and served.   That said, the servers we've had at Ocotillo are always pleasant and eager to please.  They most likely have no idea how frustrated the patron may be by the time they get to the table due to the confusion at the hostess table.  There has to be a way to get this down and to be more welcoming about getting patrons seated promptly and drinks served in a timely manner.  The owner needs to get involved and oversee the process!!   Not sure we will pick Ocotillo again unless friends want to go there.  It was a pretty big "turn off" to be treated as if we were surprise visitors causing a nuisance.

np3LDKeBnKfahg_kl51gtw.text: Great fresh seasonal food from beginning through dessert. The place is clean, wine list great and food is delicious. It you are tired of chain food and want an excellent meal, visit this place.

aUP_1NZa4dn9oLQUZerNfQ.text: Not impressed at all. We came for dinner on a Saturday evening around 7-ish, They changed 3 different waiters for us, and all 3 were super slow. When we ordered drinks plus some food, the waiter came back 3 times with bad news.They ran out of sparkling water, ran out of Mexican draft beer and ran out of brussel sprouts...how do you run of out these things on a Saturday evening when you  know it will be busy? I waited for my pepsi for like 20 minuets, it came in a very small glass which only lasted 5-6 sips and never got a refill of any kind. The food was very basic at best. My wife and her friend only ate 1/2 of their salads because there was nothing in them and no flavor at all. Way overpriced for what it is. I give it 2 stars because their outside patio looks nice, otherwise mehh. I'm not going back.

Vab7RWvDg_zRGbbWIYez-A.text: excellent service! great atmosphere and awesome food! I will definitely come back for  brunch!  I had the flautas they were amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. brisket, flautas and pancakes!
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mimosas!

EvcuF4WUnVz6M-bbAoOL_w.text: This was not my first time at Ocotillo, and I like coming here. 2 weekends ago we had brunch here and the food is good. They have a variety of breakfast and brunch items. My review is as follows for this visit:  1- Reception: The hostes received us warmly with a smile, and as soon as our party was completed we were given the available options and were seated right away.  2- Service: Our server was very friendly and kind. She made sure we were taken care of, as well as the waters and coffee were continuously refreshed/refilled. I am so sorry I do not remember her name because i think she deserves the recognition. She is worthy of my 5 stars.  3- The restaurant/facilities: I love this place, it gets my 5 stars for the set up. Restaurant was clean and the men's restroom was well attended and clean as well. The noise level can be a bit loud, especially on Sunday mornings when they have live DJ, which is a nice touch but at times it can be very loud inside.   4. The food: I got the Summer Fattoush salad which I honestly was not a fan of it. The menu description was good, and interesting because coming from a middle eastern background I know how fattoush is made but this was a modified Fattoush, with ingredients that sounded good, but when i got it, the taste was a bit off. I also made the mistake of adding chicken on the side, but even just the fattoush on its own was so overwhelming, with tons of ingredients that i could not identify each one by just tasting.Again, the description listed all the items, and i got the dish knowing whats in it, but when tasted it, the flavors did not get along very well in my opinion. Fattoush does not have corn, feta cheese, nor almonds in it, so if these were to be removed, it may make the dish more acceptable This os my personal feedback,  the dish may work for others. .

4W6Ylt07FG5DDcfcQCwnkA.text: Update: Giving one more star as someone (they didn't identify their position) from Ocotillo responded to my review right way. They addressed the menu changes (I certainly understand that restaurants do this) and photos, and that I did have prosciutto, they cut it to resemble bacon. What they didn't address was the long wait for our meal and that it wasn't hot. Also that grilled bread is a personal like/dislike and sorry that I didn't enjoy it. Well I've had grilled bread before and I do like it, but not cold! They invited me to come back to get a better impression of the restaurant. Thank you for your offer, but my husband and I will pass.

c0vMOD3pdZPPBid-ogOgyQ.text: We have been here several times and sent friends here. The food and service are always excellent. The bar makes great cocktails too.  I'm glad they went back to the original cauliflower recipe; I order it almost every time.

FL8annqkFaMxcIv8q56Sdw.text: Second visit to Ocotillo with party of four.  Two chicken dinners, one spicy duck, one beef ribs.  Atmosphere is great, service is good, food...meh.  Pita bread appetizer was pretty bad.  Pita was kind of dried out and folded into a big mess.  Hummus was tasteless.  Olives and feta were good but how hard is it to serve olives and feta?  Duck was incredibly hard to eat as were the beef ribs my buddy ordered.  We were both throwing elbows sitting next to one another trying to cut our dinners into bite sized pieces.  Flavors were ok but presentation and difficulty in eating the dish made it less than great.  My side dish was green papaya salad -- I don't think I have ever had a GPS but this one was either a poor example or they must just suck overall.  Our party was in agreement that the food was "just OK".

vC3n4LYaJ34tjkVEJkhZFQ.text: So I want to like this place but I won't go back. First off I must say that the property is beautiful, however if that's what I was looking for in a restaurant I'd eat at the desert botanical gardens.  Honestly the pita hummus plate was really good, with a giant piece of Nahn. Our server was mediocre at best and seemed to be preoccupied. When the food runner brought out our apps he didn't bother to bring plates. The server also never told us about any specials, which I guess there was discounted wine and happy hour. As far as the main courses goes it was just mediocre. The beef ribs were a site to behold but not super tender and the sauce was lacking substance. The lemon linguine pasta had way too much lemon in it and for a home made pasta was just mediocre. Also, this place is LOUD. It seems to be more of a happy hour, drink spot than someplace I would ever lay down $40 for a meal. Won't be back, your food and service is wack.   Update. The manager that was standing around doing nothing that day, blamed and criticized his server for the horrible service. As he was sitting around doing nothing. Hah. Also the manager or owner went ahead and sent me a message saying I was wack, so I went ahead and took it down to 1 star. Way to go customer service! Idiots will make sure to tell everyone I know how  this place is.

FyqHoCaR0mKj-SWQD594Kw.text: It gets 2 stars because the food was decent, and the atmosphere adorable. But Eli was our server, and I have never felt more disrespected in a restaurant than I did last night. My friends and I sat on the Arik to celebrate a birthday. One of my friends has food allergies, and was asking questions about the entrees, and after she asked 3 questions he stated, "you get one more question and you're done!" that's when we started to notice his attitude towards us. After that he started to take our orders, he completely skipped me and the girl next to me, and even though we called his name as he started to walk away, he ignored us. When he finally returned to the table about 8 min later, I pointed to my friend and said, her and I would like to order now, i think you forgot us earlier. He said, with a massive attitude and a tone just under yelling "No, I Asked if you guys wanted anything else and I gave you Pleeennty of time to make up your mind!" *insert eye roll* Excuse me?!? It was So disrespectful our whole table fell silent, but I could not.. I calmly said, "you actually did not ask her or myself what we would like to order, but we are wrong? your saying it's our fault you didn't take our order?" He said nothing, so I continued to place my order and he asked me my name (which he did not ask anyone else) 2 min later another server walked out with My meal and said, "your server said you requested your food be served before everyone else?" No I did not, and we all felt it was a calculated move by Eli to, i don't know, embarrass me? Call me out? I kindly asked the new server to hold my food and please bring it with everyone else's so we could all eat together. Eli NEVER came back to our table, we got our food and no one checked on us for at least 20 min, we ran out of waters and drinks, until I asked for someone to send over the manager. He was very nice and switched our server, and Alecia was very sweet, they brought out complimentary dessert, but all that is besides the point. The whole experience ruined our evening and left us all feeling uncomfortable, some of my friends wanted to leave before the food even came, it was so uncomfortable. There is No excuse to ever be rude and disrespectful to the customer. I would only go back if I knew there was no chance of ever running into Eli again.

GPJqSwESxwYgrJ_6r0-XCg.text: Started with the Maine sea urchin with squid ink pasta which was excellent.   The drinks arrived after the appetizer but our waiter did the right thing and comped my beer (he said the delay was because the keg had to be changed).  Mains were beef ribs w espresso mole and Ocotillo chicken.   The ribs (5 meaty bones) were excellent as were the large plate of accompanying fries (served w cilantro and lime - surprisingly a good pairing).  The chicken was juicy and flavorful although the dates underneath were maybe a tad sweet for the dish.   Had the chocolate cobbler for dessert.  Am a big dessert fan and there wasn't anything wrong with it , but after everything else it was "just fine".   Overall, a good find and would certainly come back.  Only four stars due to just OK dessert and slightly slow (but friendly) service.  FOLLOW UP COMMENT: I realized when we got the bill that beer was not in fact comp'd (contrary to what we were told).  I took it off the tip instead.  Not a huge deal, but less than ideal.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v6ll7da2tjCZmFnJsPX32w.text: I have visited Ocotillo a handful of times and I am so in love with it. The space is large, open, and inviting; it really has a delightful atmosphere. Whenever I go to Ocotillo I am excited to try something new because the menu is unique and the food delivers on flavor and freshness. I highly recommend the carrot top pesto and fresh mozzarella - outstanding! The balsamic strawberries and ricotta are also incredible. The ricotta was so creamy and the richness was cut by the acidic, sweet, and savory balsamic strawberries! MMMM...!

PRXhoAEkEhyjoCFlCNYVow.text: I went for dinner with my friends on Friday night and the food was excellent. The architecture of the building is unique. The ambiance was very pleasant. The signature vodka drinks had a different flavor than the traditional drinks. Overall, we were very pleased with all the courses from appetizers to dessert. I'll definitely go back!
