Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool outside patio

9PGPzu1f_RUacdKoKBA4yw.text: The brunch here is amazing. We sat outside in the beer garden and it was such a nice place to relax and drink mimosas! I had the breakfast chimichanga and it was amazing! Everyone in our party was happy with their meal. I will definitely come back here again!

13_OC4_m1yyvlWOOaqjYvw.text: Love this place, miss this place. The coffeeshop does a lovely mocha and absolutely off-the-chain desserts if you time it right with the chef's whims. The restaurant does delicious brunches and lunches, though one companion of mine declared it "too fancy for [him]" (this seems to be a common symptom of mid-twenties dudes who don't know how to cook). This is one of the food spots that makes me miss Phoenix.

PrAa5WBZz7v-TtTPVvhTUw.text: Fantastic! We have been here before with great results so we decided to back for my Son's 27th birthday.   Again, everything was superb. Great waiter, great water guy, the food was fantastic and the restaurant was clean and beautiful... You must go!

EhbNrxYAZBqFEVbkd1TvQw.text: Wow just wow! Stopped here for brunch, it was near our Airbnb and had great reviews. We wanted something different since we were visiting from NJ. The outdoor ambiance was perfect, something like we haven't experienced before. We were greeted right away and seat almost immediately. Our server named Miley was super nice and helpful!! The food was great, overall a perfect brunch experience over many laughs!! Would definitely recommend this place to friends who are visiting!

MY-F8MSdfrc9Skp6yXa4UA.text: Came here for Galentines day dinner. My friend and I ordered the Brussel sprouts for apps and pasta for the main entrees. Our server was generally grumpy, probably because it was valentines day and they were swamped. Our pasta entree tasted good, however the toast it came with was completely burnt and inedible. Pasta portions were also small compared to what they're charging. Overall it was a meh experience. Maybe it was an off night due to the Valentines rush.

yrBQ5k0YIx8cZLTLjr44SA.text: Super disappointed by this place. We made reservations for 7 people for a business birthday lunch on a Monday afternoon and definitely wish we would have gone somewhere else. The restaurant itself is absolutely beautiful, inside and out. It seems like it might be best to just go for drinks when the weather permits outdoor leisure.   Our server wore a dirty, backwards MLB baseball cap and looked/acted more like a cook or busser than a server. (If you've ever worked in the food industry, you know what I mean.) We ordered appetizers, and those were decent and timely. Our food took a while, but it was the busy lunch hour so not too odd. What really bummed us out was how terrible the entrees were.   My salad came without any dressing and with tomatoes (which I was super specific about because I'm allergic.)  They took my salad and brought it back out still without dressing, and I could tell the'd just picked the tomatoes out as there were left behind juices and tomato seeds. Furthermore, it came without ingredients it said were in it on the menu which made for a super bland, dressingless salad... Then I found a legitimate leaf from a garden weed; furry, spiky and all. Yuck! I wish I could say my dish were the exception, but...   One coworker had an overcooked salmon with a side a mushy, bland, lukewarm greens and another a salad overrun with onions. One ordered the smoked brisket sandwich and was pulling out huge chunks of fat. From the half of the sandwich she choked down, over half of the brisket was fat sitting on her plate. Our birthday-guy ordered the brussel sprout chicken salad, and that thing even looked gross! The chicken looked and tasted like it was boiled and several days old, and the brussel sprouts were so bitter and hard. They must have been at least a week old. It was absolutely covered in cheese too, I assume to disguise the rubbery, pale-gray colored strips of chicken on top.  Only one of us enjoyed our meal, and that was our carnivorous, garbage disposal coworker. For sure, will not be going back and will tell others to steer-clear. Definitely wish I would have taken pictures, but we already felt awkward sitting without eating and leaving plate fulls of food without asking for to-go boxes.   Our server could obviously tell we didn't like the food, and made a point to ask which we were honest about but didn't make a fuss. Didn't ask for a discount or manager or anything, just super bummed it was such poor quality, bland and just over-all bad food.   Not super important, but we didn't even get offered a dessert menu even though we made a point of telling our server it was a coworker's birthday.   Maybe we just came on a bad day, seeing that the reviews are generally positive, but that comes out to a very expensive bad day...

4Md3TQAIIrgXcT4MLW-Fhg.text: I really enjoy Ocotillo! I have never dined in- I have always order to go.- Every-time I order to go the bar tenders are super friendly and fast! I think I have tried pretty much everything on the menu and I can't complain about a single entree.  - I'm a little disappointed that they no longer offer the fish and chips, but the grilled salmon sandwich makes up for it! :)

rH_tme9FL78DkrnHEuxs8w.text: What an absolute treat! I was looking to sample local flavor and for a great lunch while visiting Phoenix on business and found this restaurant on TripAdvisor. I was intrigued by the menu and decided to give it a go. From the very beginning the staff was welcoming and warm. Dave the General Manager was so nice, engaging all the customers at the bar in conversation, really made me feel like I was setting down for a meal in his home. The bartender serving me (I unfortunately didn't get his name) was very cheery and engaged, made great suggestions and was great at anticipating my needs especially when my mouth was full of ribs and my fingers full of sauce! The smoked beets were fresh, cooked just right and chilled to perfection for the hot day. I went for the ribs for the main course which were amazing. Super tender with just enough char to give them an amazing flavor when paired with the mole bbq sauce. I will definitely be back and I will definitely be bringing some friends!

nI5IccgDYgg7BVZgBkv7RQ.text: After a duo of experiences here, once for dinner, once for brunch, I can safely exclaim and about to the mountain tops that I'm a fan now.  Yesterday, my group of 9 was well taken care of and attended to by our waiter, Michael K! Despite us hogging the table long after we were done and some being indecisive in the beginning, he handled us like a champ! He was so nice and always asking if we needed anything and if everything was to our liking.  The food was great as expected! I went a bit lighter on my entree choice, the avocado toast. The bread was Noble Bread, which I absolutely love! I also asked for that salmon topping to add some protein in there. The salmon was so tender and not crusted over like some other smoked salmon tends to be so I was sooo happy. The only thing my hubby complained about (mind you, he was stealing food off my plate!) was that he thought it was a bit too citrusy. I didn't mind it so much because I like lemon squeezed on my seafood anyway, so to each their own.  His brisket on polenta was a real treat. To be even, I stole half his polenta and 1/3 of his brisket to make sure I got all of my protein since he ate some of my dish. It was indeed also tender but that's how the short ribs were when I had dinner here.   I also ordered the bread pudding doughnut with chocolate and sprinkles, because I needed something sweet to balance the savory. It came in a skillet and topped with ice cream just like a pizookie is served but it was even better. I was nice and shared a few bites with other friends but it was definitely rich and not so healthy! They were upset that I tempted them with such wonderful heavenly sweetness!   All this food paired with mimosas and a Bloody Mary! I couldn't ask for a better Sunday morning... well along with the team USA winning women's FIFA World Cup before we got to brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket on polenta
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread pudding donut with ice cream and sprinkles
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ribs!!!

NYpjBWkcl_56B9H9fWw7qg.text: Alright.   So their decor is on point. Presentation is lovely. These make for a great overall ambiance.   HOWEVER  I don't get why this place is so popular. Everything is so damn bland! Honestly, it bums me out. So let me tell you what we got:   Fried chicken sandwich, comes with side of fries Cauliflower OG Roasted Brussels sprouts Eggplant meatballs Shoestring french fries with Parmesan Crispy hashbrown cake Ahi bowl Tagliatelle pasta and shrimp in red sauce Linguini with toasted garlic   We also got most of the signature cocktails.  The dudes refilling our waters were on top of their job. They were great. Our server was sweet.   The only things I would recommend are the Eggplant Meatballs, the ahi bowl, and the Cauliflower OG (the green sauce really set it apart). I didn't mind the Along Came a Hummingbird drink, but several of the others were a very weird mix of flavors that didn't particularly mesh that well together (one was a moonshine drink, another had elderflower something in it - sorry, I really should have taken a photo of their new menu).   Overall, I wouldn't return.

0z-VIimSwGYzk04ucZOilg.text: I've been here twice now and everything is always so good! They get really busy on the weekends, so I recommend calling to see if you can make a reservation. I've only been here for brunch and they have a pretty good size menu. Also, when you check in, you get a free coffee or mimosa. I ordered their rotating iron skillet pancake. I can't remember what kind it was at the moment, but this thing was huge and I wasn't disappointed.   I definitely want to come back to try their dinner menu. They also have happy hour as well and very cute patio seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rotating skillet pancake

rtWVIH3XSmbXCHaC9xNH8w.text: Weekend brunches here are a must try! I have been here on several different occasions for breakfast and lunch and have never been disappointed. Ocotillo has consistently great food quality and service. Not to mention, their facility has always been immaculately clean.   Our table had free mimosas with the Yelp check-in, it's a great way to start your brunch!  P.S. They also have kids menus and crayons.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Free brunch mimosas(or coffee) with check-in! Ordered mine sans OJ.

_HLkJU2aziv7vwH1izHd3A.text: Gem lettuce salad was so good. Reminiscent of a thai salad with peanut dressing. Would get with the chicken skewer.  Also has a beautiful patio. Great for a nice weekday lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gem salad with chicken skewer

G5Bk0gaXuD7RFMphkzb4rw.text: You have name called and called us coke heads, losers, morons- I joke but you are serious. And now stalking us!The owner is stalking me and commenting on my pictures. Telling me in messages that he loves me! Fellow Yelpers- I had to file a police report. The owner will stop at nothing to send hateful threatening messages.

oks7sJlHCLlo3Bdj7XtyMA.text: There's ample parking in the back and an indoor bar with indoor seating as well as an outdoor bar with outdoor seating.  I've come twice, once for dinner and once for lunch, and both times it was not packed.   I had the "Charred Sweet Potatoes" which has avocado, pickeled red onions, herb garlic butter, and baby greens for around $10. It essentially tasted very plain, it lacked flavor. It tasted like a warm salad without a dressing. I could barely eat it.  The second time I ordered the "Smoked Beets" which had herb Ricotta, Baby Arugula, local pecans, Arizona honey, and bee pollen for around $9. The herb Ricotta went very well with the honey and pecans. However, the beets did not taste smoked at all, they just tasted like regular boiled beets.  The place itself however is very beautiful! I would come back to try drinks but I don't see myself coming back to eat anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The &#34;Smoked Beets.&#34;
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside. Nice triptych.

g4l2FiQxPC9FGfGOfl7KdA.text: The place is really nice and looks like it belongs in a movie. The staff were awesome and Brandon at the bar was the best. He took care of us and was a really cool dude.  We had salmon plate and an Ocotillo egg and avocado toast plate. It was very good and we enjoyed the entire experience.

ab4Rk0mtrmN4v99w9uFV1w.text: Such a cute brunch spot! Our server was phenomenal, the food came out quickly, and was DELICIOUS! Good size portions and very reasonable pricing! Decor was very trendy and the restaurant and bathrooms were super clean!  Will definitely be coming back soon!

-d4-Up6lbV5uqmONRSc1vw.text: We had an amazing lunch here on a Saturday around 1. It was busy but not too crowded; we got a table no problem even without a reservation. Ocotillo is a large space.. walking in from the parking lot you pass two outdoor bars on the right and left before entering the main building. Lots of space to hang out and have a drink outside. Once inside they have an indoor dining room, bar area, and another patio off of the dining room.   On weekends they serve the brunch menu but it still has a nice variety of sweet/breakfast items, lighter plates, salads and some more "lunch" items. We sat inside since it was drizzling a little bit outdoors but I would recommend checking out the outdoor space if you can.   Our server was super nice, on top of coffee and water refills and quick. We tried the brunch burger (my girlfriend asked for it plain and with regular fries instead of hot fries- they were great with the changes), the ahi tuna and the gem lettuce salad.   The burger was super tasty and the fries were as well. My girlfriend said it's been one of the better "restaurant" burgers she has had. She usually doesn't eat the entire burger and fries when we go out but she finished this plate!  The ahi tuna was soooo good. Sometimes I am skeptical ordering ahi plates because some restaurants seem to just have them because it's "in" now and they aren't very great. But I look a gamble with this one and it sure paid off. The tuna is on a bed of cucumbers and forbidden rice which adds a nice crunch. Avocado on top with a sesame vinaigrette, it was to die for. Perfect for lunch.   The gem lettuce salad also had a mix of carrots, radish, cucumber, onion, crispy brown rice, basil and this awesome ginger-peanut dressing. My dad was a fan and let me try some, even I enjoyed it and I'm not a huge salad person.   The only semi-downside was it was pretty loud inside, however this is a place where many groups gather for brunch or celebrations so I would just come prepared. Beyond that we had no complaints... I will certainly be returning to check out their dinner menu or when I am in the mood for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Plain brunch burger with regular fries
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WNiznVPH2IHDcpIHKxsF3g.text: This stop was recommended by a friend.  This could be the best patio ever!   Eli knew our friend Jose.  There were a lot of unique items on the menu and Eli was superb in his detailed explanations and understanding of the menu.  Thanks Eli for making Bertha's bday celebration a night to remember.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HskzZb9BZ59vhFv9IBz44w.text: What a great spot for a late lunch! We had just flown in to the airport and were looking for a cool local place. Ocotillo was perfect. The waiter was very helpful in listening to our likes and dislikes and guiding us to menu options that would please each of the people in our party. We shared a delicious vegetable plate, followed by salad, cheesesteak, and chicken shawarma. The sweet potato was scrumptious and we loved the sauces that came with our dishes. Great service, free parking, and a good value!

du7CSt6Fn7UD1s5Z0T6Bvw.text: First off, our server Kyle rocked: he fielded all of our menu questions with grace & info. A family of foodies, we like to know the intimate details of every little ingredient. Yes, we ask things like "is this beet salad the same one you used to have?" "are the eggplant meatballs vegetarian?" etc. etc. etc.  Ocotillo delivers on flavor, variety of options for gluten free, pescatarians, vegetarians, y mas. They also serve generous portions. And did I mention the gorgeous indoor/outdoor setting and seating?   We ordered different dishes from different categories & shared.   SMALL PLATE: Ahi Tuna -- I don't eat sushi any more but my brother & sister-in-law raved about this dish. The presentation awed us with avocado slices fanned out on the plate, contrasting with pink Ahi, black rice, pale green cucumber, doused with a sesame-yuri vinaigrette. Asian flair galore...  VEGETABLES: Beet Salad - melange of flavors was like a party in my mouth. I gobbled this up & no one else got to eat much! Love love love the beets, mixing w/ savory herbed ricotta, and drizzle of honey  + crunch of pollen. All on a massive bed of arugula... (Yes-This does taste like their former beet salad :) Eggplant "Meatballs" -- surprisingly scrumptious! They incorporate eggplant with something like falafel mix/bread crumbs to bind them, laid on a bed of creamy polenta, surrounded by a moat of pesto. We couldn't get enough of...   SALADS: Carrot Fattoush -- a colorful blend of lettuces, radishes, mint, seeds and the most delectable CARROT hummus we've ever tasted (actually I've never had ANY carrot hummus before), dressed with Meyer Lemon vinaigrette. Pieces of khubz (flat unleavened pita-type bread) decorate the salad, adding a nice crunch, like flat croutons. Mmmm Mmmm good...  SANDWICHES: Salmon sandwich - luscious piece of salmon on a hefty ciabatta roll, laced with avocado, tomato, arugula and a light lemon vinaigrette. Can't go wrong with this standard favorite.   Ocotillo is always a good choice: impress out-of-towners, organize an impromptu girls' lunch, or celebrate a special occasion, like Wednesday!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. SALADS: Carrot Fattoush
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. VEGETABLES: Eggplant &#34;Meatballs&#34;
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. VEGETABLES: Smoked Beet Salad - not much left!

wbaJu2DLro8DP1G7-VZx9A.text: Im bummed that I won't he able to hit this place on a weekly basis for happy hour, dinner or Sunday brunch.  Hubby and I were in town for a long weekend, him for tactical combat training and I... lounging with friends in pjs all day long.   We had a red eye flight back to DC and had made plans to get together with hubs childhood friend and pastor before heading to the airport.   Phoenix was also an annual trip visiting friends when I lived in SD but never really ventured out for the food scene. This time, didn't  want to miss an opportunity to check what's cooking in the city. So I scoured yelp all morning deciding which hip place to enjoy quality food with quality people.   Well, I must say the whole experience was a hit.   - Parking at the back was limited but a couple was pulling out of their spot as soon as we pulled in, SCORE!!! There's also plenty of street parking available.  - Grounds and ambience was incredible... from the walk way lined with lit trees to picnic tables, lounge areas with fire pits, open kitchen and bars galore. This whole establishment probably spans the entire block of 3rd st and flower. I felt like I was in a swanky park having a picnic.  - Food was outstanding. We ordered roasted beets,  Mesquite chicken, falafel and Rueben sandwich. I was not hungry so I went for the beets and they were incredible. Roasting the roots made it even sweeter. The chicken was crispy on the outside and very tender and moist inside.  - Staff was extremely busy but very polite, friendly and prompt with our orders.   We were seated next to the open kitchen on a high table. It was loud from the bar next to us and craziness in the kitchen which woke my sleeping 10 month old the minute we sat down but she loved watching people and walking about on the table. So if you have little ones this may not the place to take them... well, at least not as late as 9pm.   I can't wait to be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aJz-l_TaUnxLVOBCbrfx4Q.text: Outside area was reserved for our party of 50+ people, so they can accommodate big parties which is so awesome to know! Service was great, they had several helpers walking around as well.   Bar staff was hilarious and very nice, they got pretty busy at one point but still making great interactions with their customers.   Food which we tried so many different things and EVERYTHING was delicious. So many options to choose from as well, which is hard when its on a menu and you have to choose one. I lucked out and had a little bite of everything-- yes dessert too!   Cant wait to come back and have more of a restaurant experience inside. I already know food and staff will be awesome just have to make it back down that way!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Iced tea
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Another view of the outside area

lMKrZEQxI8Q6XqhTPwEZMA.text: At a glance, this restaurant is superb! I went during the night and there was a forest of illuminating trees. Bordering the outdoor dining area including a fireplace. While being seated indoors for a fairly large party, the area was clean, modern and attractive. Probably one of my favorites. Josh helped recommend wine before we ordered and also helped us choose our plates as well. We ordered the pasta with chicken ragu, a filet minion served in a charcuterie board, two orders of beef ribs, a chicken dish, wings, and a squash soup. That sounds like a lot but we all finished it cause we don't play. Every plate had such a unique flavor that we all enjoyed. I'll definitely be coming back here and aiming during the day time for brunch menu! Josh was an amazing server.  As I returned for a second time with a large party Katia(?) gave us exceptional service and was pleased to have her! The beef bones are always a must have when going here. I also appreciate the birthday dessert complimentary to our party and a lot of first timers that I brought loved this place. Definitely a Phoenix Staple.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KPXDSQSmKQk62xaNhwWAaQ.text: Great staff. Our waiter was awesome. He rolled with our large group's sassy responses. He made it fun. The food is always outstanding although they run out of the good stuff early. So, get there and order your favs early. If you don't have any favorites yet, you will when you return.

pI_60lOvMZgEJk5Wx0DzIA.text: Never a bad meal. Never! This has become our go to spot to take visiting friends for brunch and dinner and it always impresses them, and us. One of the most creative menus where unexpected ingredients and flavors blend harmoniously. Bonus points for the kid friendly beer garden green space and outdoor bars (2!)

HtVgVWzNGgp9IXyJ_YFDGg.text: Wowwww. I definitely should have been coming to ocotillo for HH more! We arrived around 4:20 on a Tuesday with no trouble parking in the lot behind the restaurant. I was mesmerized by the walk from the parking lot to the restaurant with all the beautiful bloomed trees! Since we had a dog in our party, we sat outside at one of the tables in the covered patio and were brought waters right away. I ordered a Moscow mule and the crispy hash brown cake from the HH menu. The drink was just a standard Moscow mule, delicious and refreshing, but not anything special.  The crispy hash brown cake came with smoked brisket and a fried egg on top. It was delicious. The brisket was so tender that I didn't even need a knife! The egg broke and was perfectly runny. The runny yolk made the sauce even more decadent. I used the hash brown cake to soak up all the gravy. I will have to come back to try the brunch at some point! Definitely do yourself a favor and try this restaurant out! The food is absolutely worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Walkway into the restaurant
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy hash brown cake
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moscow mule

hfauIHx1N4QTXTRBAi06Lw.text: Decided to try this place out after hearing a lot of good reviews from friends. Parking wasn't great unfortunately but is to be expected in this area on a Saturday night. I thought for sure there was going to be a long  wait but we were surprisingly seated immediately with options for inside and out.  The ambiance here is where this place really shines in my opinion. It has a modern interior with an industrial looking exterior. The outside area is really cozy with fire pits, heaters, and mood lighting.   After a recommendation from the waiter I got the Wood fired beef ribs, and my friend got the mesquite grilled chicken. I was shocked at how big the portions were. It says "large" on the menu category but I wasn't expecting so many huge delicious ribs and a giant chicken leg quarter. The food was very tasty, albeit a bit on the pricier side.  All in all this place has a great atmosphere with some really nice food and cocktail options. I can see why this place is so popular. Can see myself coming back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wood Fired Beef Ribs
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fire Pit
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mesquite Grilled Ocotillo Chicken

kHQXmQ2-NgMGd2q-OOb5yw.text: Lunch and dinner, AWESOME.   Foods are not factory foods.  Each dish is artful, delicious and full of surprises.   The Roasted Beet salad is on my order everytime.    I recently ordered the salmon, WOW.   The skewered pork bellies were utterly sublime.   They changed up the dessert menu so I missed the chocolate cobbler and bread pudding, but the ricotta pound cake with lemon curd, berries, and toasted fresh made marshmallow was pretty darn good. I had a new signature martini with ginger, peach and pomegranate.  They flavor layers were incredible.   The "beer garden" is our favorite seating, outdoor but protected from weather.  the sofas and fire pit are intimate and invite conversations.   GREAT JOB!

GuRB_2I3YpnNWN-9eVGQFQ.text: I came here with some friends based off word of mouth, not looking at the menu prior. Let's just say wow! I wasn't particularly impressed with the menu looking at it, but ordered the Ocotillo Chicken. I would say it was maybe one of the best chickens I have had prepared. Comparable to the Elements at Sanctuary. Everyone else loved their food. The big plates might be a bit spency- but easily shareable between two with an appetizer.  Next time I am getting the ribs! They looked amazing.

9eJcjtWaJBMkI9x3QnQdRw.text: We were so looking forward to spending time at Ocotillo because we've heard so many great things.   We won't return after leaving without placing our order.  We arrived with our novels, ready to order coffee drinks and nest while construction was occurring on our home.   The service on a Saturday morning around 10:30 at the coffee bar was deplorable.  We were literally abandoned by our server.  We had to continually request milk, a top for cup etc.  We were not impressed.   Upon realizing that it was too chilly to sit outside we went inside to the restaurant.  Although we were not yet ready for lunch we thought we could find some brunch items which would allow us to be inside.   The first two items I selected could not be adapted for my food allergies because the items were 'pre-prepared'. After listing my food allergies the female Server started arguing with me. I suggested she not argue about my food allergies since she Knew nothing about this and was clearly Not listening based on her alternate suggestions.   she then stormed off.  We got up and left and won't be back. I recommend you go someplace else if you need any accommodations.

SffluwDZeTs1AFMIc2MGRQ.text: ***Updated*** The manager has apologized to me, and that means a lot to me. It takes a lot to admit when you are wrong and I also understand how it is easy to become defensive when it comes to something you are passionate about. I wish them the best of luck moving forward.  ***Old Review*** Wow. I had to change my review because now the manager, Walter S. had the audacity to "compliment me" a message on Yelp cursing me out, saying I was ignorant and tried to insult me saying I must eat at "Subway" or "Denny's". People are entitled to their opinions. That's what Yelp is all about. I didn't even give that bad of a review. I made sure to point out all the positives and a said I would give it 3.5 stars. I have gotten bigger, better salads at many other restaurants, Olive & Ivy, Maizie's, FEZ... Just to name a few.  Walter, this is your wake up call. You can't afford to act like this. All the people who work at the restaurant and who have invested time and money into that place rely on it's success, and it cannot afford to fall because of a prideful man who cannot take criticism.

DIYa0D1GwDkC3JeJDnPq4A.text: This restaurant is amazing the food is great and staff is very friendly. We had Taylor as our server and had great recommendations for us to try for wine and the food based on our taste. We definitely will be back to try there brunch

Zy89qxrh-VADKKRhEwBqnQ.text: The food is amazing here!  We had a larger group, so we started out with a bunch of small plates: octopus, pork belly, wings and hearts of palm.  We were lucky the night we went because they had an off-menu special of paella- which fed 5 of us nicely.  Craft drinks were awesome!  Great experience!

LiMq7lwuubhrnkc7iPx4Vw.text: This place is phenomenal - was in town for a work conference from NY and decided to give it a try.  I was in Phoenix a few months before and all of my food was terrible so I was weary,  this place knocks it out of the park.  The flavors are original and work so well together and the portions are HUGE - you normally don't find that when the food is this high quality.  It has never been harder for me to choose after seeing everything the large group seated next to me had ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

u2s4rLH0u2q2xl_5_PwYvw.text: 8pm reservation...arrived early and got seated at 7:50.   7:55 - waiters and what looks to be like a manager or owner have an argument by our table...waiter walks by and apologizes.  8:00 - no water no waiter  8:05 - no water no waiter   8:06 - we walk out  Would have liked to try what looks to be delicious and creative dishes...hopefully they get their act together on the service!

BqZFE9s2w74BwuTPbdx8iQ.text: Heard of this place over and over again in various local articles, so when we were in Scottsdale again we went out of our way to come over and have brunch. It lived up to the hype, creative food and good portions. Had brisket and blue corn pancakes. Will come back again, for sure.

_ks-9OVdKTN3knj9em6KxQ.text: Seriously one of the coolest restaurants around. Amazing atmosphere filled with very gracious staff. It's incredible how classy this place is but feels so comfortable to be in--almost like you're gathering to eat at a family reunion, the only difference being how incredible the food is. The menu is inspired and widely incorporates an exquisite variety of seasonal choices sourced from the valley! The bar does an excellent job preparing very full and delicious drinks as well as pairing a careful selection of wines to the dishes (ask for Dave for a special sommelier service).   The prices may be high, but this place is a testament to "you get what you pay for." I have spent thousands here and don't regret a single penny.

Q1lvY6EtdxqlM48ZEWV33A.text: This place brings something a little different. The menu is full of fun new dishes with interesting ingredients. The beer selection is good enough, and the outdoor space is awesome during the cooler months. The owner brings a great vibe and the staff is knowledgeable. Good find in midtown.

rdSUshIc_K2--9AQPMbTTQ.text: I've been to Ocotillo a few times and have enjoyed their salads and small plates but the other day I decided to order their Ocotillo chicken to go. BAM! That's what my taste buds said the moment I put this deliciousness in my mouth. Actually, even before that taste my eyes were like - oh yeah!  You get two pieces of chicken with skin on the bone and underneath is this revelation of a potato salad. The overall flavors are sweet and spicy due to the honey and chili's. The juice from the chicken kicks up the potato salad flavor even more. Game changer. I have to admit that I find the atmosphere a tiny bit pretentious so I haven't loved my dining in experiences despite the lovely decor, but I won't hesitate to order out this chicken regularly. That way I can also dive in with my hands like this chicken demands :-). The bartender who took care of the to-go's was super nice and welcoming, thank you!

wxsirYlAJfzPsbelP9fUdQ.text: Melt in your mouth. I cannot wait to visit this place again. It is on the pricey side so I would recommend it for a special occasion with that special someone. The atmosphere was really laid back, the only downside was that the music was a little loud, but it was damn good music anyway. Would say reservations are a must, we went on a Saturday night with no reservation and had a little bit of  a wait. Thankfully the outside patio is a great place to relax while you wait.

qkcVTwsscZBo3Gu9UQiNnQ.text: Cool spot with a great location, setup and vibe. However my food came out cold (not cool, but noticeably cold) in the middle and upon being reheated a second time, underwhelmed.  By the time my food came back out, my coworker was done eating. Disappointingly, there was no concession or apology for the mistake. I wasn't even thinking it would be comped, but at least maybe a free drink or something   May or may not be back.

ss5p6q1IgFD-pENfKo06Rg.text: Great food and service, our friend wanted to try it out so we drove over 30 min from Scottsdale and it's so worth drive.  We had a total of 4 dishes: fried lobster, octopus, crispy duck confit and ribs.  Every single one was super tasty.  Definitely coming back to try out their other dishes.

LF8jNFd1EJT6v5m7A_a3-Q.text: This. This is exactly what I want when I come home. So quintessentially Arizonan. Lovely outdoor space with picnic style seats and loungey sofas. The space is courtyard style so you feel totally encapsulated and are surrounded by desert landscaping, concrete, rust and wood. Part coffee stand, part restaurant, part outdoor lounge.  The sheep's milk ricotta small plate was SO GOOD. Sun dried strawberries? What? Plus our server was nice and gave us an extra basket of that grilled bread.   We also got the fried zucchini, simply because it came with burrata and my sister and I are addicts. Thankfully it was good here (I am ever amazed at the poor quality of burrata out there).  We drank craft beer and sat in the sunshine and ate good food. Man, I miss AZ. Thank you Ocotillo, from the bottom of my heart, for this lovely lunch on my last day in Phoenix.

D-_LokcpfUEUQUh1cr6axA.text: This place is an overpriced wanna be. First we ordered moscow mules which were the worse drinks we ever had. They didn't even have copper ups for them  and at an "establishment" like this there isn't an excuse. We spent almost $400 for four people to eat and we ordered steaks  and one person had the ribs. I don't eat carbs yet they would not allow me to substitute the starch for a veggie. The cook staff looked rough and were kids, and had neck tattoos and the wait staff were shooting air dart guns to kill flies or other things off tables. There was no shortage of staff and no patrons when we went and yet the mirrors at the bars were totally funky and nasty and the bathrooms had hair on the sinks, other funk and felt like a gas station bathroom. The best thing we ate were the salads. Very good but all the food is heaping portions. I expected a little more refined class at this place so I was disappointed in the Applebees experience. Too bad I didn't Applebees prices. Maybe they rock the brunch out, I don't know...but for the price, this place offers nothing special. We had two birthdays that were on the reservation and they didn't even bring out the complimentary dessert that most places would have. However, with the huge portions it wasn't needed but just goes to the class of the joint. None.

17IA4ltfgpA9ngHcAHRAJA.text: AMAZING outdoor atmosphere..... Stopped in for a quick lunch on the front patio. Ordered the Pecan Wood Smoked Beets (a tasty dish of ricotta cheese, arugula, truffle honey, pistachios, herbs, and olive oil, oh... and did I mention the BEETS? BEAUTIFUL BEETS?!?)  We also ordered a pitcher of Red Sangria. Quite possibly the BEST Sangria I have ever tasted. Large, tasty pitcher.  Definitely returning to Ocotillo for more goodness....

dMD0n7yzm3Sj0tgtpxi8WA.text: Came here on a whim since there were so many good reviews but i am honestly disappointed. I took .5 stars off because our waiter was so awkward and stood there in silence for a minute. Another .5 stars off because they say this place is American but there was no American anything on the menu. I took another star off because the dishes my friend and I ordered were mediocre. I took .5 stars since they were out of boba...how do you not stock enough boba for your one specialty dtink? Lastly, the noise and atmosphere I took .5 stars off for. The place is super loud and they're trying to be fancy when the place is super casual. Not impressed.

05WtzSMpFAmFp6HbCjn86g.text: Super busy on Sunday.  Told 30-45 min wait so we grabbed a bar spot.  Lots of tables though so I'm not sure if that was accurate.  Service at the bar was friendly and quick.  Food was large portions but tasty.  I had the skillet pancake (for like three people) and she had the brisket.  The pancake was huge and thick.  A pretty unique rendition but flavour was light and fluffy.  They also have buckwheat pancakes that makes this place a bit unique.  The brisket was cooked perfectly and very tender.  The location was hip with nice indoor and outdoor seating but extremely loud inside due to poor acoustic design that so many of these "industrial" designs suffer from.  Overall a positive experience.  Expect brunch weekends to be packed and loud.  Lots of the seating is communal as well if that matter to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Several outdoor social bars in the same seating area for more social meetups.
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor covered seating. Fans and swamp cooler nearby for summer seating.
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket with polenta, expertly cooked. Huge portions

hB8FS3DfP16TS-ChjUYQIw.text: Fabulous service!  We came here with a large group of about 70 people after our sons graduation and the staff here did a phenomenal job.  The food was delicious and arrived quickly ... they were on top of things from the moment we arrived.  Absolutely recommend this restaurant 100%!

Z7POzcdp6FqjV4xjLT9C9w.text: Delicious great atmosphere inside and out. Lots of options, large portions, everything uniquely different and full of flavor!!!! We will be back. Service was excellent too!   I came back and brought a few friends and ordered many different selections on the menu to critique them all and I will say they are point on with these recipes and flavors. The Chef knows what he/she is doing. Happy Happy:) My only suggestion would to add an acoustic guitar player for some entertainment the outside patio areas are inviting and would love to be able to relax and hang out.  My original 4 stars is now 5

gVBmjTEoZniEKPjhH1NWgA.text: Absolutely fantastic in all regards! Love this place, especially the Halibut ceviche.

YbnlurizbcpqfSK26vjRnw.text: Ocotillo has become our go-to spot for brunch in Phoenix. We have yet to have a negative thing to say about the place. First off the space is beautiful. Plenty of seating indoor or out and a sharp clean design. Service has been nothing but excellent and I'm not sure the kitchen isn't staffed by cyborgs considering the speed at which our food always arrives. Ocotillo is the PERFECT spot to grab a tasty bite and some bottomless mimosas to kick off your Sunday funday or if you're feeling a little more tame it's still just about the best breakfast food in town. You kind of owe it to yourself to check this spot out.

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ocotillo Bowl is a dream. Incredible hash brown cake lurking in the background.
Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Pork Flautas! Like woah.

NK-XWnzoo9HKC2WhNUMfRw.text: 1:00pm - 12.23.2017 lunch visit date; Beautiful contemporary building; nice atmosphere; excellent food; horrible service on the patio;  Attention Front of the House Manager:  focus on service - it shouldn't take ten + minutes to get first round drinks to be delivered to a table - the appetizers came out before the drinks!  Our server was preoccupied with a very large party - our service suffered badly.  Too bad, because the restaurant is very nice. Of course, they could have had some insurmountable problems that day, so I will try it again to see if the service gets any better.

x7Ajh_NLWAezPDT9Yut0KA.text: Love, love this place!!  The ambiance is the coolest...the staff is one of a kind...and nothing comes close to the food & drinks. Almost died when I tasted the Bloody Mary.  Highly recommend!!

-43B-PfqFv-IPJGbcL44zQ.text: We had a very good lunch, big portions, fresh and healthy food choices.  David the owner, was very accommodating and helpful. He offered multiple suggestions of neighborhood restaurants to check out during our trip We ordered the cauliflower and fish and chips. Both dishes were delicious! And the fresh coconut was great

dzhFsYOxGQOwf9anKpZjQg.text: Went with a large party it had to have been the worst service of any restaurant I have ever been to in the Phoenix area never got offered a second drink and the food left a lot to be desired one restaurant in the Phoenix area I would never recommend

UlmEwsCaDKHpVTvu0FPjVw.text: Vibes vibes vibes! The environment was ever so endearing! If there's one thing I would suggest getting is the pancake...WOW! It is huge and filling and took 3 of us to finish it! I ordered the salmon and wasn't a fan which is why I helped my friends out with their pancake and let me say I'm glad I did!

9iPvRXsHKhm0o1eSnC1r3Q.text: Food was great, I hate the fact that i ate while on a full stomach. Man, anyways great experience and shoutout to Corben. Great guy that was patient and informative with helpful suggestion.

F_WA61rVUa71O8jjRZxKSw.text: Found a sweet new place-check it out! They have inside and outside brunch and dinner plus a coffee bar, bier garten  and a lot of cool outside space with bistro lights and a fireplace for those cool evenings to sit and chill with your friends or loved one..best part of all..they are fur baby friendly!! The service was a little slow especially with coffee refills but the food was presented well and tasted excellent! The price was more than your standard diner but appropriate for more high end brunch, service and ambience.

6QFIrCqGztjTDLgr1oz0FQ.text: With a high expectation for customer service, this place did not disappoint. I haven't been this impressed and satisfied in quite a while. Within 2-5 minutes of being seated, our server was prompt and pleasant. Even more, when we asked about menu suggestions I appreciated his knowledge base. Often when going to eateries, not many servers can vouch for their product...disturbing to say the least! But, not at Ocotillo!  The server recommended this amazing Korean BBQ Sandwich and my goodness, it was delish! We were eating within 15 minutes of order, likely sooner. Aside from good eats, it's all about the vibe. Another 10/10 for Ocotillo with good music, great space, and amazing people. I seriously don't know where they have room for improvement at this point. Maybe just teach other eateries how to be that amazing!

7n2tNBY5G_8SaoeRteDN4A.text: Place is fancy to hangout, great drinks but food lack basic taste. Ordered smoked beets(over sweet), halloumi cheese(why will you give 2 big piece of cheese), duck confit salad(very salty). Ordered couple of drinks which were great hence 3star. May be will try brunch since it's hugely popular place.. hopefully food will be better.

h6NhEajGG27dn1gPpKW3GQ.text: I just don't know what I'm going to eat at Ocotillo! The menu is awesome. There is really something for everyone. House made pasta! Beef ribs and a great selection of summer veggies. I seriously come here to eat so much the friendly staff like May the bartender knows my favorite drink. Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Ocotillo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w-QOOpU2_S0ZY3n0SlGdhg.text: Today was the second time here. We walked away the first time because it's so damn noisy. My son was with us today ....so when we arrived he asked the hostess for a quieter spot to sit. She sat us on the north side patio, which was so much nicer.Corben, our server was efficient with great service. The menu is short and sweet. This tells me food is fresh. I had the brisket with polenta. Very tasty, the presentation was excellent on all dishes at our table. I must say though.......the lemonade was amazing!!!!! We were all satisfied with what we ate. This isn't your ordinary restaurant, all in all satisfying.

HNHjF_mVDetE1hLKSEYiTg.text: The Food wasn't the best. it was just... okay. it's really the atmosphere that's nice.

qQT9VywA1jA3OXUsTKCqrQ.text: There was a lot of new stuff going on near downtown these days hopefully they can all look at this place and model off of it it's fun it's a lively the place is wide open outdoors and perfect for Arizona had the brisket sandwich sorry for no picture and an amazing salad.  Our server John was very informative and friendly and kept the drinks, and great job guys will definitely be back
